import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

df = pd.read_csv("../input/complete-energy-profile-of-india-1965-2019/EnergyScenario.csv")
df.dtypes
source.5f1b6a2e:
df = df.drop("Entity", axis=1)
df = df.drop("Code", axis=1)
source.aa42d80c:
from sklearn import linear_model

target = "Energy consumption per capita (kWh)"
X = df.drop(target, axis=1)
X = X.iloc[:,1:-1]
y = df[target]
clf = linear_model.LinearRegression()
clf.fit(X,y)
print(clf.score(X,y))
source.adffb6f0:
cdf = pd.concat([pd.DataFrame(X.columns),pd.DataFrame(np.transpose(clf.coef_))], axis = 1)
cdf = cdf.set_axis(['Name', 'Value'], axis=1, inplace=False)
cdf = cdf.sort_values(by=['Value'], ascending=False)
cdf
